intro: Plectritis ciliosa subsp. insignis, commonly known as the slender pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom in late summer to early autumn.
